item.title: ğŸ‘» Ghost CMS l A Short Review (2021)
item.description: Before you skim through this article, let me make one thing clear: I do not hate WordPress. Why would I, there are endless possibilities, right? Well, in my eyes, all the possibilities have led to an overloaded system. The type of system that is slow, or stops moving. This is the reason I do not work with WordPress. Nope, not even for a tiny little project. I learned how to create a website, but when it comes to handling users & payment, I saw this will take me a lot of time to create on my own.

item.title: â˜” Flashback 2 - It's Getting Messy
item.description: Note: This article was first published on 07.02.21 As promised, I will open up the micro start up garage door wider, so you can see what’s actually happening behind the scenes on a day to day basis. So, let' start with What actually happened last week? Things have gotten pretty messy, as I am balancing my January project on the one hand and starting out my February project on the other.

item.title: ğŸ“ September Review
item.description: Overview Note: The review is regarding part of my work and only displays a look into a facet of a project and does not include all income/revenue I generate ğŸ™ğŸ½ After months of hard work and no full free weekend, I finally took 5 days off in September. ğŸ§˜ğŸ½â€â™‚ï¸ Prioritizing mental health and re-energizing is crucial, but often neglected as a founder. ğŸ¤¯ There are so many stories of founders' burnout, and it happens faster than one thinks.

item.title: ğŸ”Œ Flashback 1 - How a power cut nearly ruined 3 weeks of hard work
item.description: Note: This article was first published on 31.01.21 The last weeks have been quite a adventurous ride for me. On the day I launched my January product I had a power cut in my house. Yeah, a real one. Didn’t charge my laptop over night - 30% battery. No Electricity No Wifi. Nice. But, I’ll get to that in a bit. Let us start with the question of Why am I actually doing this stuff?

item.title: âš¡ Flashback 0 - My One Micro Startup Per Month-Challenge
item.description: Starting the fist step from â€œI have an ideaâ€ to actually doing stuff is really hard. There’s term and a whole discussion around people who only have business ideas, but never act on them: “Wannapreneur” While there are many different opinions on what differentiates a “Wannapreneur” from an Entrepreneur I think these 3 key aspects get you caught in the “Wannapreneur”-Cycle Thinking and talking about your idea/s without actually acting on them Consuming way too much Online Content ( Hi, GaryVee!

item.description: Overview Note: The review is regarding part of my work and only displays a look into a facet of a project and does not include all income/revenue I generate August was the month of hard and sweaty client work. I was really lucky and grateful to close 3 clients at the end of july. Whereby I helped 2 clients with remote team building and one with remote workflow and documentation.

Nevertheless, here are some insights on the traffic. Time 01.05.21 - 21.08.21 Overall Traffic Pages Interesting, that my longest piece of content is also the best-performing so far. --- For more real-time updates feel free to join me on Twitter Linkedin

item.title: ğŸª Keeping a clear mind as a solo-founder
item.description: Going on a solo-adventure has many upsides. Full flexbility. No one to account to. Moving quickly. But, there are certain risks. Imagine you are hiking on your own. ğŸš¶ğŸ¾â€â™‚ï¸ The colourful mountains are illuminated by the sun. The wind breeze is seemingly playing music on your clothes. ğŸŒ„ You feel fully energized about going some extra miles and run up the hill and simply just do as you please. Amazing.

item.title: ğŸ“ July Review
item.description: Note: The review is regarding part of my work and only displays a look into a facet of a project and does not include all income/revenue I generate Overview It’s kind of strange. I’ve read a dozen times that things do not go as expected whilst starting a business. But now, that things really went different from my goals and plans it feels kind of weird. So, “bad” news first"

item.title: ğŸ£ From 0 to 1: Learnings From My First 3 Months of Switching Careers and Client Hunting
item.description: “Just start a service business”. Sounds pretty easy, right? Wrong. Going from a product-focused to a service-based business is more challenging than I expected. Here is why: I do not have an established network in the field I am diving into. I made two switches at once. From: Type of work: Full-time employee Field of work: Marketing To: Type of work: Self-Employed Field of work: Team Building Although I read about making a double switch not being recommendable I just went on and did it.

item.title: ğŸ’¡ Cal Newport On Control
item.description: â€œ Giving people more control over what they do and how they do it increases their happiness, engagement, and sense of fulfillment. â€ â€” Cal Newport

item.title: ğŸ“ June Review
item.description: Note: The review is regarding part of my work and only displays a look into a facet of a project and does not include all income/revenue I generate Greetings friend from the WWW, as mentioned in my earlier post I am going to publish my progress on a monthly basis. Progress is currently slow, but steady. Paid Media Experiment The Google Ads Campaign has brought traffic and one person booked an appointment via the website calendar.

item.title: ğŸ˜± I Soft Launched My Website and I'm Embarrassed
item.description: I get it. You want a good product. Yet, I have to launch early. And fast. Like really, really, really fast. “If You’re Not Embarrassed By The First Version Of Your Product, Youâ€™ve Launched Too Late” â€” Reid Hoffman Fast means accepting imperfection. This is why I decided to soft-launch Remote ‘n Active - List on a Sub-Reddit yesterday. And talk to people from my target audience. And send it to a couple of friends.

item.title: ğŸ”¦ Show Don't Tell
item.description: As I’ve been seeing very low conversions on remotenactive.com I decided to post on IndieHackers.com in the Group “Landing Page Feedback”. I then got a reply from Jonathan Lee, who runs pagereview.io. He created a pagereview feedback page for me with really valuable feedback I must say, I think this is really cool. If I had a team, or more people working on the product/site, I would definitely give it a shot as it makes design critique really easy.

item.title: ğŸ”¥ r/startups (766k) Post Of The Day. Here's what I did
item.description: Yesterday, on the 14.06.2021 I got to the post of the day with 125 upvotes. Link to the post Here is how I created the post. Topic It’s not always easy to come up with topics to write about. I have been experimenting with different kinds of posts on LinkedIn and noticed one of my posts had a pretty high engagement. Here are the LinkedIn stats on my post about my learnings about attending the Y Combinator Free Startup School.

item.title: ğŸ§­ Tracking My Goals and other changes
item.description: I’ve been working out in public for nearly 6 weeks and have reflected on my learnings. Going on forward I will continue with these changes: Tracking my goals on a monthly, not weekly basis (weekly internally) Keeping my articles in english, german translation only on requests This will improve my public productivity and help me improve content creation, as certain work flows took up more time than expected (e.

item.title: ğŸ“š What I learned in 12 weeks at YCombinators' Free Startup School
item.description: Why join a Startup School? School is boring after all. Or is it? Learning how to start and maintain a successful company within the boundaries of a school like system seems somewhat uncanny when you think of it. School was not always fun. Most of the things taught can often not be applied to the “real life”. Sir Ken Robinson even goes so far to say that the current education culture is a “Death Valley”.

item.title: âœ¨ Meaningful Connections
item.description: Social Media is often perceived as a superficial place were egomaniacs just try to show off how cool they are. That’s at least been my impression of some online communities. But, it really comes down to how you approach this way of communicating online. It really helps to view each and every person online as somebody you see at a party, event, on the street or in the supermarket. Even out there in the real world you come across colorful individuals.

item.title: ğŸ“ Weekly Goals #2
item.description: Info Setting clear goals is crucial to make sure I am moving into the right direction and stay accountable. These are not all To Do’s, but rather the most important things I am working towards on a weekly basis. Mindset After talking to another founder I noticed my approach towards Sales was completely wrong. I am now adjusting towards creating meaningful online connections. Not slamming the door open and trying to sell.

item.title: ğŸ“¡ Weekly Status Report #2
item.description: What happened last week - 17.05 - 21.05.2021 Feedback regarding my goals #1 The good Got the remotenactive translated English website up and running Wrote 5 Cold-Messages via LinkedIn Sales Navigator One Phone Call with a prospect Let my LinkedIn Network know about my new career, reaction very positive The bad Did not reach the goals of 15 cold messages, 2 Case Studies Reasons: translation of website took me longer than expected, LinkedIn Cold Messaging Research on how to adress the audience took me longer than expected LinkedIn Sales Cold Messages not successful so far What’s Next

item.title: ğŸ™‹ğŸ¾â€â™‚ï¸ English, Please
item.description: I started out by defining my main target audience for remotenactive.com as being from Germany. I am fully aware that the topic is adaptable to an international audience, but to niche down as much as possible I am currently focussing on the German market. But, more and more requests for an English website have come up. “Is the website also in English?" So I started out thinking of ways how to translate the website without spending hours.

item.title: ğŸ•Šï¸ The Price of Freedom
item.description: Being self-employed comes with the illusion of total freedom, green grass, warm sun, blue sky all day and everyone around you singing “Kum ba yaaah”. Or something like that, I guess. :) The general notion is: Do as you please. No schedule. No boss. Nice. But: total flexibility can lead to chaos. That is my take at least. Which is why I have created working structures and habits that keep me accountable and productive.

item.title: ğŸ“ Weekly Goals #1
item.description: Setting clear goals is crucial to stay accountable as a founder. I have set overall business goals, but noticed I have to get a stronger focus. That is why I am setting weekly goals. These are not all To Do’s but rather the most important this I am working towards on a weekly basis. Business Sales: Digital outreach to at least 15 new prospects Get 2 Case Studies Talk to at least 2 prospects Website remotenactive.

item.title: ğŸ‰ Remote Work has a problem, which is why I started RemoteNActive
item.description: I’ve made my first experience with remote work as a marketeer in Berlin in 2015 with my agency team distributed across Germany, our main client with a team across Germany, Europe and the US. I then also did some digital nomading in 2017 and loved it. Especially the flexibility to choose when and where to work got me hooked. The year 2020 has pushed the digitization around the globe and especially in Germany to an unprecedented degree.

item.title: ğŸƒğŸ¾â€â™‚ï¸ Typeform Has Left the Chat
item.description: When Typeform first went live, I was absolutely thrilled. Suddenly, polls were fun and not that annoying anymore. The design was minimalistic, beautiful, playful, but still professional. But unfortunately, as with so many good technical products, it simply became more and more expensive over time and/or the free functionalities were increasingly restricted. Typeform is collecting dem cash The design and UX are still very good, but the starting price is very high at 30 â‚¬ / month (“Essential”).

item.title: ğŸ¤³ğŸ¾ Mobile First
item.description: I’ve read it so often, and I was really surprised, when I forgot about the mobile versions of my projects. Even in the advertising industry we often had the discussion of starting out with the mobile version of an ad or thinking about how the creative out will play out on mobile. Although I must say I have made the experience that consumer driven websites often indeed have a higher mobile share, but b2b oriented services or websites often have a slightly higher desktop/laptop share.

item.title: ğŸ™…ğŸ¾â€â™‚ï¸ No
item.description: Saying no is often not that easy. That’s why I use the website “How to say no” when I politely have to deny a business request. Copy, paste, customize a word or two. Et voilÃ . More time in your head for the essentials.

item.title: ğŸ‘¨ğŸ¾â€ğŸ’» Learning UX Design Online: My Experience
item.description: Why it’s important to understand current technologies The Netflix documentary “The Social Dilemma” has impressively shown the manipulative influence of social media on our everyday life. Thereby one thing became clear: Not being informed can be dangerous. If you don’t understand how certain systems, apps, and websites work, you are more prone to manipulation. It used to be different, wasn’t it? Technologies have become an indispensable part of our everyday life.

item.title: ğŸ’¡ Why this website is the way it is
item.description: Website builders: There are now so many like a dime a dozen. When I asked myself how to set up this website, I thought pretty quickly: “Definitely not with Wordpress” Don’t get me wrong, Wordpress is a great solution in some cases. Just not for me. I wanted full flexibility with the least possible effort in the creation, as in the maintenance, and that’s why I ended up with Hugo.

item.title: ğŸ† Online
item.description: The site is online now.

item.title: About
item.description: Hi there friend from the WWW âœŒğŸ¾ After almost a decade in the advertising industry, I’ve made the decision to start my own business. Since my first experience with remote work in 2015 I am a true advocate. I value the freedom and flexibility, but I’ve made the experience that the human level is neglected in this technical world. I want to change that and am therefore working on RemoteNActive.
